page.title: 18MICRO HYDRO_ELECTRICITY,RHUM
page.content: From the beginning of the 20th Century Rhum has benefited from hydro_electric power. However, the various systems employed were inadequate and socially unacceptable for the "high_tech" electricity consuming 1980's. There_ fore,in 1983/4 a new 240 volt 50Hz AC system was installed, producing a maximum of 45 kilowatts. Islanders could now use most contempory electrical appliances. In the summer of 1983 a new 1500 metre pipe line was laid (the original had been in constant use since the early 1900's). This carries water from a small dam situated at 190 metres height. This feeds water to a power_house in which, in early 1984, a new turbine of the Pelton wheel type was installed. This, coupled to a 30 kilowatt, 3 phase brushless alternator generates the majority of the islanders' power needs
